get.summary: Get status of all cron tasks
get.description: Returns the status of all currently running cron tasks

post.description: Starts all predefined cron tasks (minute, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
Start a cron task by its ID. Available task IDs: minute, five-minute, hourly, daily, scheduled-daily, weekday, weekly, monthly, thirty-second, multiple-daily, business-hours

post.summary: Schedule a job to run immediately
post.description: Schedule an Agenda job to execute right away. Available job types: process-data, send-email, process-image, generate-report, cleanup-old-data, send-webhook, backup-data, send-notification, recurring-task, process-batch

jobName.description: Name of the job type to execute

data.description: Data to pass to the job

post.summary: Schedule a job for a specific time or relative time
post.description: Schedule an Agenda job to run at a future date/time. Supports absolute time (ISO date string) or relative time (number of seconds or string like 'in 30 seconds'). Examples: 30 (runs in 30 seconds), 'in 5 minutes', 'in 1 hour', '2024-12-25T10:00:00Z' (absolute time)

oneOf.description: Number of seconds from now (e.g., 30 = run in 30 seconds)
Relative time string: 'in 30 seconds', 'in 5 minutes', 'in 1 hour', 'in 1 day', or ISO 8601 date-time for absolute time

data.description: Data to pass to the job

get.description: Retrieve all Agenda jobs, optionally filtered by name or status. Each job includes status, execution times, and time until execution.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by job status: 'running' (currently executing), 'failed' (has failed), 'scheduled' (waiting to run), 'completed' (finished)

nextRunAt.description: When the job will run next

lockedAt.description: When the job was locked (started running), null if not running

failedAt.description: When the job failed, null if not failed

failCount.description: Number of times the job has failed

repeatInterval.description: Recurring interval (e.g., '1 day'), null for one-time jobs

isRunning.description: Whether the job is currently running

post.description: Schedule a job to run repeatedly at specified intervals (e.g., '5 minutes', '1 hour', '1 day')

interval.description: Interval string (e.g., '30 seconds', '5 minutes', '1 hour', '1 day')

data.description: Data to pass to the job
